action.name: Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+2) kinetic damage.

action.name: Wrist Blaster
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) energy damage.

action.name: Wrist Blaster Volley (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The super battle droid sprays a 10-foot-cube area within normal range with shots. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking normal weapon damage on a failed save.

action.name: Rocket Launcher (1/Day)
action.text: Each creature in a 20-foot- radius sphere centered on a point that you can see within 150 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description:
The B2 super battle droid is an upgraded version of the B1 battle droid, with superior armament and armor. It features dual integrated wrist blasters. The B2-HA model is equipped with an integrated rocket launcher.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Bantha, Adolescent

trait.name: Trampling Charge
trait.text: If the bantha moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the bantha can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8+6) kinetic damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 21 (3d10+6) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
Banthas are a species of large, hairy mammals with sharp, spiraling horns. They inhabit the desert planet Tatooine, though they are bred on many worlds throughout the galaxy. They are social herd animals, and are often domesticated, and used prominently, by Tusken Raiders as mounts and companionship. Although the Tusken Raiders never kill Banthas for their food or hide, they are utilized by many other species for products such as Bantha steak, butter and clothes or furniture.
Biology and Appearance. Banthas are quadrupedal mammals that average in height 2 to 2.5 meters. An adult's average weight is 4,000 kilograms, and they have extensive shaggy fur, which is brown or black in color. Both females and males of the species have a pair of spiraling horns that extrude from their skull and grow at a knob a year. Banthas possess a wide mouth, bright, inquisitive eyes, and a large tail which drags on the ground as they walk. They have wide, flat feet with four digits.
Pop Culture. "Bantha fodder" (or "Bantha poodoo" in Huttese) is a phrase used as the equivalent of "worthless"; a person or thing deemed to have no value beyond something for a bantha to graze on, because of bantha food's unpleasant smell. "Not give two bantha ticks (about something) meant to not care in the slightest (about something or someone), "Son of a bantha" was an insult, and "A wild bantha chase" meant a futile errand.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Bantha, Adult

trait.name: Trampling Charge
trait.text: If the bantha moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the bantha can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8+7) kinetic damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 29 (4d10+7) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
Banthas are a species of large, hairy mammals with sharp, spiraling horns. They inhabit the desert planet Tatooine, though they are bred on many worlds throughout the galaxy. They are social herd animals, and are often domesticated, and used prominently, by Tusken Raiders as mounts and companionship. Although the Tusken Raiders never kill Banthas for their food or hide, they are utilized by many other species for products such as Bantha steak, butter and clothes or furniture.
Biology and Appearance. Banthas are quadrupedal mammals that average in height 2 to 2.5 meters. An adult's average weight is 4,000 kilograms, and they have extensive shaggy fur, which is brown or black in color. Both females and males of the species have a pair of spiraling horns that extrude from their skull and grow at a knob a year. Banthas possess a wide mouth, bright, inquisitive eyes, and a large tail which drags on the ground as they walk. They have wide, flat feet with four digits.
Pop Culture. "Bantha fodder" (or "Bantha poodoo" in Huttese) is a phrase used as the equivalent of "worthless"; a person or thing deemed to have no value beyond something for a bantha to graze on, because of bantha food's unpleasant smell. "Not give two bantha ticks (about something) meant to not care in the slightest (about something or someone), "Son of a bantha" was an insult, and "A wild bantha chase" meant a futile errand.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Battle Hydra

trait.name: Reactive Heads
trait.text: The hydra gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Two Heads
trait.text: The hydra has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Wakeful
trait.text: When one of the hydra's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hydra can make three attacks: two with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) kinetic damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) kinetic damage.

action.name: Stinger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) kinetic damage. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description:
The Battle Hydra is a type of large reptilian dragon-like Sithspawn that was created by the Sith Lord Exar Kun. They are known to have two heads that sit atop long, fluid necks. The heads hold a pair of yellow slitted eyes. There were some varieties of these beasts that have more than two heads.
Behavior. When left to their own devices, these beasts are mindless and shy creatures-a sharp contrast to their fearsome appearance. Battle hydras are known to be solitary animals that hunt alone. They spend most time aloft where they ride thermal currents in search of prey or threats. When prey is spotted, the battle hydra dives through the air, snapping with multiple jaws as well as their poisoned stinger. Once prey succumbs to either the attack or poison, the beast takes the corpse back to its lair where it is torn apart and devoured.
These animals are, however, susceptible to influence or commands from Force-sensitive dark side users. Many of battle hydras have been used as personal shocktroopers for these dark-lords. Battle hydras are known to be particularly attracted to sites that are strong in the dark side of the Force. It is believed that perhaps these beasts draw some form of nourishment from these locations.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Baudo-Class Star Yacht, "The Banshee"

trait.name: Starship Traits
trait.text: Shield Points: 19 (quick-charge shield)
Shield Regeneration Rate: 16
Hyperdrive: Class 2 (Backup Class 7) Crew 2
Passengers: 8
Cargo: 35 tons
Consumables: 1 month

trait.name: Evasive Maneuvers
trait.text: (4/maintenance) When the Banshee rolls for initiative, it can immediately move. This movement happens before the initiative order is determined. The amount the ship moves is determined by rolling a d6 and multiplying it by 50 feet. The ship then gains that many feet that it can move or spend to turn.

trait.name: Armament
trait.text: Turreted:
Quad Laser Cannon (2)
Forward-Facing:
Light Laser Cannons (2)

action.text: The ship can take up to four non-attack actions as well as many attack actions as it has weapon hardpoints.

action.name: Quad Laser Turret
action.text: Makes 2 Ranged Ship Attacks: +2 to hit, range 450/900 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) energy damage.

action.name: Light Laser Cannon
action.text: Makes 2 Ranged Ship Attacks: +3 to hit, range 300/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) energy damage.

action.name: Interdiction Drive (Recharge 6)
action.text: (2/Maintenance) As an action, a deployed mechanic can engage the interdiction drive. Each ship within 100 feet of your ship must make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + the mechanic's proficiency bonus + your ship's Strength modifier). On a failed save, a ship's flying speed is reduced by 100 feet and its turning speed is increased by 50 feet until the end of the mechanic's next turn. If a ship is two or more sizes larger than your ship, it has advantage on the saving throw. If it is two or more sizes smaller, it instead has disadvantage.

monster.description:
The Banshee has the following starship traits. Modifications: The Banshee has 16 modification slots, including those granted by its size and role. It has the following stock modifications:
• Operations: Hyperdrive Slot • Suite: Luxury Quarters • Suite: Recreation
The Banshee has 14 mod slots, filled with the following modifications:
• Engineering: Interdiction Drive • Operations: Backup Hyperdrive, Navcomputer Slot • Suites: Escape Pod, Two Living Quarters, Medbay
Universal: Premium Thrusters • Weapons: Three Fixed Hardpoints, Gauss Rounds, Two Turret Hardpoints • Hyperdrive Class 2 (Backup Class 8) • Crew 1 • Passengers 7 • Repair Time 8 Hours • Maintenance 1 Day • Units of Fuel 30 • Fuel Cost/Unit 100 cr • Food Portions 120 • Cargo 25 tons
Source: Dawn of Defiance: The Traitor's Gambit

monster.name: BB Series Astromech Droid

trait.name: SW5e Skills
trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Circuitry
trait.text: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The astromech droid has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Spellcasting (Techcasting)
trait.text: The astromech is a 3rd level tech caster (tech save DC 13, +5 to hit with power attacks, 15 tech points). The astromech knows the following powers.
• At-will: jet of flame (tech), mending (tech), minor hologram (tech), on/off (tech)
• 1st Level: decryption program (tech), expeditious retreat (tech), hologram (tech), repair droid (tech), target lock (tech)
• 2nd Level: translocate (tech), motivator boost (tech)

action.name: Shockprod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) lightning damage.

monster.description:
The BB-series astromech droid was a model of astromech droid manufactured by Industrial Automaton and active during the era of the cold war, featuring a spherical body that allowed the droid to roll in any direction, with a head usually atop the body but not meant to be permanently physically attached to it (which would inhibit the droid's ability to roll around). Like earlier astromechs, the BB unit could fit into the droid socket of a starfighter.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Bendu
monster.immune: lightning, poison, sonic, kinetic, ion, and energy damage from unenhanced weapons

trait.name: SW5e Skills
trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the Bendu moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 17 (4d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 22 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 ft. away and knocked prone.

trait.name: Enhanced Attacks
trait.text: The Bendu's attacks are considered enhanced.

trait.name: Innate Forcecasting (Spellcasting)
trait.text: The Bendu's forceasting ability is Wisdom (force save DC 22). It can innately cast the following force powers:

• At-will: force push/pull (universal force), force sight (universal force), force throw (universal force), sense emotion (universal force), sense force (universal force), sever force (universal force)
• 3/day each: force repulse (universal force), force project (universal force), force suppression (universal force), sanctuary (light force), telekinesis (universal force)
• 1/day each: earthquake (universal force), force storm (dark force), improved force camouflage (universal force), mass animation (universal force), precognition (universal force)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance
trait.text: (3/day). If the Bendu fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Force Immunity
trait.text: The Bendu is immune to force powers of 5th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other force powers and force effects.

action.name: Multiattack.
action.text: The Bendu makes two claw attacks and one horn attack, or it casts one force power and makes a claw attack.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, Reach 10 ft., one target. Hit 22 (4d8+6) kinetic damage.

action.name: Horns
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, Reach 10 ft., one target. Hit 28 (4d10+6) kinetic damage.

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The Bendu teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Lightning Strike
action.text: The Bendu calls a bolt of lightning out of the sky, or from the air if underground or indoors, to strike a point it can see within 60 feet. All creatures within 20 feet of the target point must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.text: The Bendu can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Bendu regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The bendu makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: The Bendu uses its teleport action.

legendary.name: Innate Power
legendary.text: The Bendu casts an at will force power.

monster.description:
Personality & Traits. Bendu was a wise and enigmatic being which resembled a giant rocky monolith with two eyes, a flat nose, and a long beard. He was a powerful entity who could control nature, including the krykna spiders of Atollon. Bendu could also sense the presence of other Force-wielders from a distance. He was a wise and patient teacher who believed that other Force-sensitive beings needed to learn to overcome their fears and imbalances through personal trials.
Powers & Abilities An immensely powerful being who possessed incredible connections to the Force and could perceive the emotions of others, he also had the power to appear and disappear at will.
The exact nature of the Bendu remains a mystery, but whether he is an exceptionally potent wielder of the Force or a literal avatar of its many mysteries, the possibility of other beings like him existing should not be overlooked. A Bogan who represents the cruel, the cold and the hateful dark side, and an Ashla standing for the compassionate, the warm, the serene light side.
Source: SW5e Fisto's Codex

monster.name: Berserker (SW5e)

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Vibroaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) kinetic damage.

monster.description: Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Black Sun Human Replica Droid (HRD)

trait.name: Human Replica
trait.text: The HRD will pass as human from all but the most sophisticated of scanners and even these are more likely to identify the HRD as organic but not human.

trait.name: Circuitry
trait.text: The HRD has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Calculated Strikes
trait.text: The HRD's attacks are considered enhanced.

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of The HRD's turns, it can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
trait.text: (1/Turn). The HRD deals an extra 17 (5d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the Assassin that isn't incapacitated and the HRD doesn't have disadvantage on the roll.

trait.name: Assassinate
trait.text: The HRD has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in the combat yet. Additionally, any hit it scores against a creature that is surprised is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the HRD is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half the damage, the HRD instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The HRD makes three unarmed strikes or three blaster pistol attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (3d8+5) kinetic damage. If the target is a creature, the HRD can choose one of the following additional effects. The target must Succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (HRD's choice). Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the HRD's next turn.

action.name: Blaster Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 40/160, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6+5) energy damage.

monster.description: Source: SW5e Fisto's Codex

monster.name: Black Sun Vigo
monster.ac: 16 (heavy combat suit and light shield generator)
monster.skill: Persuasion +7, Deception +10, Intimidation +10, Animal Handling +6, Perception +6

trait.name: Sneak Attack
trait.text: (1/Turn). The Black Sun Vigo deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the Black Sun Vigo that isn't incapacitated and the Black Sun Vigo doesn't have disadvantage on the roll.

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of The Black Sun Vigo's turns, it can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Black Sun Vigo makes two melee weapon attacks or two ranged weapon attacks.

action.name: Heavy Blaster Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack. +7 to hit, range 40/160, one target. Hit 7 (1d8+3) energy damage.

action.name: Hidden Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 5 (1d4+3).

action.name: Exude Pheremones
action.text: (Recharge 5-6) The Manipulator exudes pheromones that allow it to manipulate and control nearby creatures. Every creature within a 20 ft radius of The Manipulator must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed. Targets that do not breathe are immune.
While charmed the target seeks to assist The Manipulator by any means within its power and perspective (including attacking its enemies, and fulfilling its goals if these are known to the target).
Whenever a target takes damage and at the end of each of its turns the target can repeat the saving throw.

monster.description:
Black Sun held a massive amount of reach and influence, extending its tendrils of corruption deep in the various galactic governments of each era. It was infamous for its involvement in piracy and smuggling. But smuggling was just the tip of the iceberg of the galaxy-wide organization. It was involved in every known type of illegal activity; its information networks surpassed even the accuracy and scope of Imperial Intelligence. The resources available to Black Sun rivaled those belonging to a large planetary army, including foot soldiers.
Below the leader of Black Sun were nine Vigos (Old Tionese for "nephew"). Each Vigo ruled over his or her own territory and sector.
Source: SW5e Fisto's Codex

monster.name: Blastromech Series, BT-1

trait.name: Circuitry
trait.text: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance
trait.text: (3/Day). If the assassin droid fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The assassin droid makes three Blaster Cannon attacks.

action.name: Blaster Cannon
action.text: Each creature in a 10 foot cube centered on a point the droid can see within 100 feetmust make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 9 (1d10+4) energy damage on a failed save.

action.name: Flamethrower
action.text: (2/day). Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 36 (8d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

action.name: Rocket Barrage
action.text: (2/Day). Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point that you can see within 150 feet must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 14 (4d6) kinetic damage and 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.text: The Blastromech Series, BT-1 can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Blastromech Series, BT-1 regains spent legendary actions at the start of their turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The assassin droid makes one Blaster Cannon attack.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The assassin droid makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Rocket Boost
legendary.text: The assassin droid leaps up to 40 feet in any direction. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks..

monster.description:
A homicidal assassin droid created by the Galactic Empire's Tarkin Initiative, the BT-1 model is designed to look like an astromech droid in order to fool others. The droid is armed with a variety of weapons including several blaster cannons, flamethrowers, and rockets. The BT-1 model is also equipped with rocket boosters.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Blurrg

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The blurrg deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The blurrg has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would shove it or knock it prone.

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The blurrg is considered to be a Huge animal for the purposes of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
Blurrgs were a two-legged non-sentient species that were used as beasts of burden on a number of worlds located across the galaxy, including Endor, Ryloth, and Zygerria. Stoic and strong, they are used for everything from agricultural labor to war; the Twi'lek Resistance on Ryloth rode blurrgs in battle during the Battle of Ryloth, where they were used at the final offensive against Separatist forces in Lessu, charging at droid troops with the Grand Army of the Republic's Lightning Squadron.
The blurrg's huge mouth could chew through almost anything edible, which made it perfect for clearing savanna grass, weeds, and saplings. Blurrgs were strong, fast , but stupid—so much so that they walked right into small trees, knocking them down. The egglaying creatures usually produced 5 or 6 babies at a time. In their early years babies stayed very close to their mothers for protection from Boar-wolves. Blurrgs communicated through a series of roars. They are also vicious when driven to a fury, and are reputedly noisy when agitated.
Mounts. Rothana Heavy Engineering sold blurrgs as mounts to Imperial forces. They cost 12000 credits for six or 20000 credits for a herd of 12.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Boar-wolf

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the boar-wolf moves at least 20 feet toward a target and hits it with a tusk attack on that turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) kinetic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Keen Ears and Nose
trait.text: The beast has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Relentless
trait.text: (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). If the boar-wolf takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Tusk
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
About 3 meters tall; and having sharp teeth, a humped back, and two tusks; boar-wolves live on Endor's moon.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Bogwing, Greater

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The bogwing is considered to be a Large animal for the purposes of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bogwing can make two claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
Bogwings are a reptavian species found on the planets of Naboo and Dagobah. During the Cold War between the Galactic Republic and the reconstituted Sith Empire, bogwings were also seen in the swamps of the ruins of Taris.
Biology. Bogwings are known to be able to carry nine times their own weight and are very territorial. There are two races of bogwings: the greater bogwing and the lesser bogwing. They both feed on small creatures dwelling in the canopy, but the greater bogwing feeds in the upper levels, while the lesser bogwing feeds in the lower levels where it avoids larger predators such as the jubba bird.
Naboo. During Gulliball games played by Gungans, bogwings were released into the sky to signal halftime.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Bogwing, Lesser

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The bogwing is considered to be a Medium animal for the purposes of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4+2) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
Bogwings are a reptavian species found on the planets of Naboo and Dagobah. During the Cold War between the Galactic Republic and the reconstituted Sith Empire, bogwings were also seen in the swamps of the ruins of Taris.
Biology. Bogwings are known to be able to carry nine times their own weight and are very territorial. There are two races of bogwings: the greater bogwing and the lesser bogwing. They both feed on small creatures dwelling in the canopy, but the greater bogwing feeds in the upper levels, while the lesser bogwing feeds in the lower levels where it avoids larger predators such as the jubba bird.
Naboo. During Gulliball games played by Gungans, bogwings were released into the sky to signal halftime.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Bor Gullet
monster.languages: understands Galactic Basic but can't speak, telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: SW5e Skills
trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Creature Sense
trait.text: The bor gullet is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each such creature, as well as each such creature's intelligence score, but it can't sense anything else about it. Droids and creatures protected by a mind blank power or other similar power cannot be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Fortified Mind
trait.text: The bor gullet has advantage on saving throws against being charmed and frightened, and it can't be put to sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance
trait.text: (3/Day). If the bor gullet fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Psychic Link
trait.text: The bor gullet can establish a psychic link with any creature that it successfully grapples with its tentacles. Until the psychic link ends, the bor gullet can perceive everything the target senses. The target is aware that its mind is linked, and the bor gullet can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the psychic link, doing so with a successful DC 18 Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage. The psychic link also ends if the target and the bor gullet are more than 1 mile apart, with no consequences to the target. The bor gullet can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bor gullet makes three tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) kinetic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it is Large or smaller. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 9 (1d8 + 5) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns, and bor gullet can't use this tentacle on another target. The bor gullet has six tentacles.

action.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The bor gullet emits psychic energy. Creatures of the bor gullet's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence saving throw or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Sense Thoughts
action.text: The bor gullet targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. The bor gullet gains insight into the target's emotional state and any thoughts that loom large in its mind (including worries, loves, and hates). The bor gullet can also make a Charisma (Deception) check with advantage to deceive the target's mind into thinking it believes one idea or feels a particular emotion. The target contests this attempt with a Wisdom (Insight) check. If the bor gullet succeeds, the mind believes the deception for 1 hour or until evidence of the lie is presented to the target.

legendary.text: The Bor Gullet can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Bor Gullet regains spent legendary actions at the start of their turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle
legendary.text: The bor gullet makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Break Concentration
legendary.text: The bor gullet targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The bor gullet breaks the creature's concentration on a power it is using. The creature also takes 1d4 psychic damage per level of the power.

legendary.name: Psychic Pulse
legendary.text: The bor gullet targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. Enemies of the bor gullet within 10 feet of that creature take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Sever Psychic Link
legendary.text: The bor gullet targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The bor gullet ends the link, causing the creature to have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

monster.description:
Bor gullets are a non-sentient, tentacled species found in the galaxy. They have the unique ability to read minds, with the unfortunate side-effect of causing insanity. As a result, they were often used as a form of torture. Notably, Saw Gerrera's Partisans owned a bor gullet, and Harra the Hutt had collected a bor gullet in her menagerie on the planet Vodran.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Bounty Hunter

trait.name: Light Shield
trait.text: While wielding the heavy blaster or the techblade the Bounty Hunters AC increases by 1.

trait.name: Enhanced Tech
trait.text: When you deal damage to a creature with your weapon, you can increase the damage by 1d6. The damage is of the same type as the weapon's damage. (Damage is included in the attack section).

trait.name: Distengration
trait.text: When a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by the disruptor rifle, it must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

trait.name: Techcasting (Spellcasting)
trait.text: The Bounty Hunter is a 6th level techcaster it's techcasting ability is Intelligence (tech save DC 16, +7 to hit with power attacks, 24 tech points). The Bounty Hunter knows the following powers:
• At Will cryogenic burst (tech), targeting shot (tech), assess the situation (tech)
• 1st Level target lock (tech), tracer bolt (tech), absorb energy (tech), energy shield (tech)
• 2nd Level translocate (tech), infiltrate (tech), smuggle (tech)
• 3rd Level explosion (tech), cryogenic suspension (tech)

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Bounty Hunter makes two melee weapon attacks or two ranged weapon attacks.

action.name: Heavy Blaster Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack. +7 to hit, range 40/160, one target. Hit 11 (1d8+1d6+4) energy damage.

action.name: Disruptor Rifle
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack. +7 to hit, range 100/400, one target. Hit 12 (1d10+1d6+4) energy damage.

action.name: Techblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d6+ 1d6 +4) kinetic damage.

action.name: Carbonite Blast (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The Bounty Hunter produces a beam of carbonite energy from his wrist launcher in a 15 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 30 (10d6) Cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. On a fail the creature will have its speed halved until the end of your next turn. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.

monster.description: Source: SW5e Fisto's Codex

monster.name: Brain Worm
monster.resist: energy and kinetic from unenhanced weapons

trait.name: Detect Sentience
trait.text: The brain worm can sense the presence and location of any creature within 300 feet of it that has an Intelligence of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a mind blank force power.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The brain worm makes one enter orifice attack and uses consume mind.

action.name: Enter Orifice
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) kinetic damage

action.name: Consume Mind
action.text: The brain worm targets one creature it can see within 10 feet of it that has a brain. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw against this magic or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage. Also on a failure, roll 3d6: If the total equals or exceeds the target's Intelligence score, that score is reduced to 0. The target is stunned until it regains at least one point of Intelligence.

action.name: Body Thief
action.text: The brain worm initiates an Intelligence contest with an incapacitated humanoid within 5 feet of it. If it wins the contest, the brain worm burrows into the target's brain and takes control of the target's body. While inside a creature, the brain worm has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside its host. The brain worm retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as its understanding of Geonosian, its telepathy, and its traits. It otherwise adopts the target's statistics. It knows everything the creature knew, including force powers, tech powers, and languages. If the host body takes 20 points of cold damage in a single round, the brain worm must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw using its own Constitution score, not the host's. On a failure, the brain worm leaves the body, slithering out to a space within 5 feet of the host. After exiting the host, it is paralyzed until the start of its next turn. If the host body dies, the brain worm must leave it. The brain worm is also forced out if the target regains its devoured brain by means of a master heal force power. By spending 5 feet of its movement, the brain worm can voluntarily leave the body, slithering out to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of it.

monster.description:
Brain worms are worm-like parasites from Geonosis that have the capability of controlling minds. They hatch from yellow eggs, and are known to have been used by the Geonosian Queen Karina the Great during the Clone Wars on her Geonosian minions. The worms would sometimes enter the host via the nose, and were able to control dead Geonosians.
Brain worms react negatively to cold temperatures.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: BX Series, BX-5C

trait.name: Circuitry
trait.text: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Droid Synergy
trait.text: Once per turn, the commando droid can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the commando droid that isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Stealth Field Generator
trait.text: The droid becomes invisible. Anything the droid is carrying is invisible as long as it is on the droid. The droid may end the invisibility as a free action. The invisibility ends if the droid attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The supercommando droid makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Blaster Carbine
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) energy damage.

action.name: Techblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
The BX series commando droid is an elite battle droid model made for stealth assignments. Equipped with a stealth field generator, they are perfectly designed for espionage.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: BX Series, BX-A

trait.name: Circuitry
trait.text: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Droid Synergy
trait.text: Once per turn, the commando droid can deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the commando droid that isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Stealth Field Generator
trait.text: The droid becomes invisible. Anything the droid is carrying is invisible as long as it is on the droid. The droid may end the invisibility as a free action. The invisibility ends if the droid attacks.

action.name: Blaster Carbine
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) energy damage.

action.name: Techblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
The BX series commando droid is an elite battle droid model made for stealth assignments. Equipped with a stealth field generator, they are perfectly designed for espionage.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: C1 Series Astromech Droid

trait.name: SW5e Skills
trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Circuitry
trait.text: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The astromech droid has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Rocket Boost
trait.text: (1/day). The astromech droid leaps up to 40 feet in any direction.

action.name: Shockprod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) lightning damage.

monster.description:
The C1 series astromech droid, was a model of C-series astromech droid manufactured by Industrial Automaton. They were used during the Clone Wars and the reign of the Galactic Empire, though by then they were considered antiques and had passed their manufacturer's expiry date a few decades prior. They had three mechanical arms to manipulate objects with, and featured an electrical arc welder.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Cantina Brawl
monster.languages: Galactic Basic, any one other language
monster.conditionImmune: Charmed, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Prone, Restrained, Stunned

trait.name: Liquid Courage (Recharge 5-6)
trait.text: As a bonus action, the cantina brawl imbibes nearby alcohol to gain access to a hidden reservoir of audacity and grit. The cantina brawl gains 7 (2d6) temporary hp for 1 minute.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The cantina brawl can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the cantina brawl can move through any opening large enough for a medium humanoid. Except for Liquid Courage, the cantina brawl can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cantina brawl makes two melee attacks or two darts attacks.

action.name: Stool
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 0 ft., one target in the cantina brawl's space. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) kinetic damage, or 7 (2d4 + 2) if the cantina brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Broken Bottles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 0 ft., one target in the cantina brawl's space. Hit: 17 (6d4 + 2) kinetic damage, or 8 (3d4 + 1) if the cantina brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Darts
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 20/40 ft., Hit: 10 (4d4) kinetic damage, or 5 (2d4) if the cantina brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

monster.description:
A cantina, also known as a saloon, bar, or pub is a place where spacers, smugglers, and other denizens of the nearby area come to drink and play board and card games, such as pazaak or sabacc. Cantinas are located on almost every major planet and are often a center of criminal activity such as smuggling and spice trading.
Many cantinas provide live entertainment in the form of musicians, dancers, or fighters. Gambling is also popular in these locales. The main attractions, however, are the beverages served by mixologists or automixers, and the opportunity to meet friends or business associates (illicit or otherwise).
Cantinas are generally poorly lit and crowded. They are dangerous centers of criminal activity, and it is not uncommon for patrons to be maimed or killed within the walls, without so much as a flinch from the staff or the other patrons. Sometimes, however, things can get out of hand.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Captain

trait.name: Martial Advantage
trait.text: Once per turn, the captain can deal an extra 14 (4d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 ft. of an ally of the captain that isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The captain makes three weapon attacks

action.name: Hold-out
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) energy damage.

action.name: Techblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) kinetic damage

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the captain can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 ft. of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the captain. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the captain is incapacitated.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The captain adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the captain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Captain Vischera
monster.languages: Galactic Basic, Bocce, Durese, High Galactic

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: Captain Vischera has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

action.name: Blaster Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit 4 (1d6+1) energy damage. Reload 12.

action.name: Vibrodagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) kinetic damage.

reaction.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: Captain Vischera can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the Lieutenant. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time.

monster.description: Source: Dawn of Defiance: The Traitor's Gambit

monster.name: Carnivorous Plant

trait.name: Corrode Metal
trait.text: Any unenhanced weapon made of metal that hits the plant corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. The plant can eat through 2-inch-thick, unenhanced metal in 1 round.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the plant remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal plant.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) kinetic damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

monster.description: Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05 Awakened plants are ordinary plants given sentience and mobility through the power of the Force or technology. Source:SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Cato Neimodian Citizen

action.name: Hold-Out
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2, range 30/120 ft, one target. Hit 2 (1d4) energy damage.

monster.description: Source: SDawn of Defiance 2: A Wretched Hive

monster.name: Clodhopper

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The clodhopper's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
Clodhoppers are omnivorous, dim-witted, flightless avians from Naboo that are rarely more than three feet tall. They feed in swarms.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Combat Engineer

trait.name: SW5e Skills
trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Tactical Technology
trait.text: When the engineer casts a tech power that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the power and to succeed on the required saving throw.

trait.name: Technological Advantage
trait.text: Once per turn, the engineer can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a damaging tech attack if that target is within 5 feet of an ally of the engineer and that ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Techcasting (Spellcasting)
trait.text: The engineer is a 7th-level techcaster. Its techcasting ability is Intelligence (power save DC 13, +5 to hit with tech attacks) and it has 31 tech points. The engineer knows the following tech powers:
• At-will: acid splash (tech), jet of flame (tech), cryogenic burst (tech), electroshock (tech)
• 1st-level: smoke cloud (tech), homing rockets (tech), overload (tech)
• 2nd-level: magnetic field (tech), acid dart (tech), scorching ray (tech)
• 3rd-level: explosion (tech), tactical advantage (tech), kolto cloud (tech)
• 4th-level: cryogenic storm (tech)

action.name: Vibrostaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) kinetic damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Vibrostaff (2H)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) kinetic damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Light Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+1) energy damage.

monster.description: Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Combat Engineer, Junior

trait.name: SW5e Skills
trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Techcasting (Spellcasting)
trait.text: The junior engineer is a 3rd-level techcaster. Its techcasting ability is Intelligence (power save DC 12, +4 to hit with tech attacks) and it has 14 tech points. The junior engineer knows the following tech powers:
• At-will: electro shock (tech), encrypted message (tech), rime shot (tech)
• 1st-level: energy shield (tech), homing rockets (tech), repair droid (tech), smoke cloud (tech)
• 2nd-level: acid dart (tech), magnetic field (tech)

action.name: Blaster Carbine
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) energy damage.

monster.description: Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Commoner (SW5e)

action.name: Light Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 40/160, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) energy damage.

monster.description: Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Condor Dragon

trait.name: Unhindered Movement
trait.text: The dragon's movement speed is not reduced while moving with a grappled creature.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon can make three attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) kinetic damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) kinetic damage.

monster.description:
Condor dragons were flying, carnivorous reptavians native to the craggy cliffs, deserts, and deep woods of Endor's forest moon. They walked on their hind legs and their forearms were used to hold prey. They had bony ridges along their spine, and a wing span of approximately 3 meters.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Darga The Hutt
monster.skill: Deception +8, Insight +6, Intimidation +12, History +8, Perception +6, Persuasion +8
monster.languages: Bocce, Dosh, Huttese, Galactic Basic, Pak Pak, Quarrenese, Rodese, Ryl

trait.name: SW5e Skills
trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Dominating Presence
trait.text: (1/Rest). As a bonus action, Darga the Hutt can call out to a humanoid who can understand it that is charmed by it or frightened of it to direct their next action. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 16). On a failed save, until the end of Darga the Hutt's next turn, the creature takes only the actions Darga the Hutt chooses, and doesn't do anything that it doesn't allow it to do.
During this time Hutt Crime Lord can use its reaction to force the creature to use the creature's reaction.

trait.name: Innate Techcasting (Spellcasting)
trait.text: Darga's innate techcasting ability is intelligence (tech save DC 16). It can innately cast the following powers: • At-will: assess the situation (tech) • 3/day: absorb energy (tech), element of surprise (tech), fabricate trap (tech), oil slick (tech), smuggle (tech), spot the weakness (tech), stack the deck (tech), tactical barrier (tech) • 1/day: kolto cloud (tech), tactical advantage (tech)

trait.name: Tyrant's Ferocity
trait.text: Darga the Hutt has advantage on any attack against a creature that is charmed by it or frightened of it.

trait.name: Reassemble
trait.text: (1/Rest). Darga the Hutt may use a bonus action to call its allies towards it. It chooses a number of creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it equal to its Intelligence modi er (minimum of one). They can use their reaction to immediately move directly towards Hutt Crime Lord up to their movement speed. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Survival Instinct
trait.text: Darga the Hutt and all allies within 10 feet of it gain a bonus to their AC equal to half its Intelligence modifier (rounded down, included in Armor Class).

action.name: Hold-Out Blaster
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 30/120, one target. Hit 1 (1d4 - 1) energy damage

action.name: Overwhelming Presence
action.text: Darga the Hutt can make a Charisma (Persuasion) or Charisma (Intimidation) skill check to attempt to charm or frighten a humanoid creature who can see or hear it within 60 feet. The target makes a contested Wisdom (Insight) check. If Darga's check succeeds, the target is charmed by it if it used Persuasion, or frightened of it if it used Intimidation, until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 6 (1d8+2) kinetic damage, and the target must succeed on a

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit 11 (2d8+2) kinetic damage, and the target is knocked prone.

reaction.name: Call the Guards
reaction.text: When a creature attacks Darga the Hutt, it commands a willing ally within 5 feet of that creature to use their reaction to intercede. The creature is then forced to make an attack on the ally instead. If the attack misses, the ally can immediately make a weapon attack with advantage against that creature as a part of that same reaction.

monster.description: Source: Dawn of Defiance: A Wretched Hive

monster.name: Cyborg Khagan

trait.name: SW5e Skills
trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Villainous Hit Points
trait.text: Cyborg Khagan has multiple pools of hit points, each of which is tracked separately. Damage and healing only applies to the currently active hit point pool. When a pool is depleted of all hit points, it becomes inactive. Only one pool can be active at any time. If a hit point pool is depleted, the Cyborg Khagan immediately saves against all ongoing conditions and effects. Any abilities which can reset do so. If all pools of hit points are inactive, Cyborg Khagan is killed. If Cyborg Khagan takes a long rest, it fully heals the currently active pool and fully heals one depleted pool.

trait.name: Villainous Exhaustion
trait.text: Cyborg Khagan rolls initiative with advantage. Cyborg Khagan starts with a number of villainous actions equal to one less than it's villainous multiplier. If a hit point pool is depleted, Cyborg Khagan also loses one villainous action. Cyborg Khagan may use a villainous action after any other creature takes a turn. If Cyborg Khagan does so, it regains its reaction. A villainous action is a complete turn. They have an action, bonus action and may move up to their full speed. The villainous actions refresh at the start of Cyborg Khagan's turn and any remaining actions from the previous turn are lost.

trait.name: Jedi Slayer
trait.text: Cyborg Khagan has advantage on saving throws against force powers cast by enemies within 5 feett. When an enemy within 5 feet casts a force power, Cyborg Khagan can make a melee attack against that character as a reaction. When Cyborg Khagan damages an enemy character, they have disadvantage on Concentration saves to maintain their Force powers.

trait.name: Rage
trait.text: On Cyborg Khagan's turn, he may choose to go into a Rage as a bonus action. While in a rage, his attacks deal +3 damage, he has Advantage on strength-based skill checks and saving throws, and he has resistance to kinetic and energy damage. As part of the bonus action to go into a Rage, he can make a Lightsaber or unarmed attack. While in a Rage, all attacks against him have Advantage. The Rage lasts for 1 minute, or until Cyborg Khagan ends his rage as a Bonus action, or until Cyborg Khagan falls unconscious or loses all hitpoints in his current health pool.

trait.name: More Machine than Man
trait.text: Cyborg Khagan has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Cowardice
trait.text: While Cyborg Khagan has only one health pool remaining, he has Advantage on Stealth and Acrobatics checks, and he can take the Dash or Disengage actions as a Bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: On each of his turns, Cyborg Khagan can use one of Crush Them!, Frightful Presence, or Whirling Advance and then make one Unarmed Slam, Lightsaber, or Blaster attack; or he may make two attacks.

action.name: Lightsaber
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack. +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6+5 energy damage.

action.name: Unarmed Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack.+9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6+5 kinetic damage

action.name: Heavy Blaster Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack. +7 to hit, range 40/160, one target. Hit: 1d8+3 energy damage.

action.name: Crush Them!
action.text: Choose an ally within 30'. That ally can use their reaction to make an attack. If that attack hits, it deals an additional 1d8 damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Choose any number of characters within 80'. Each of those characters who fails a Wisdom saving throw (DC 14) becomes frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Cyborg Khagan's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Whirling Advance
action.text: Whirling his blades, Cyborg Khagan advances with a shield of sparks and light. Choose a creature within 30 feet to make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. On a fail, the target is pushed 10 feet, Cyborg Khagan moves into their current square ignoring opportunity attacks, and he has advantage on his next attack against them this combat. On a success, Cyborg Khagan moves into a square adjacent to the target and opportunity attacks against Cyborg Khagan have disadvantage during that move.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: When Cyborg Khagan is attacked and hit by an adjacent character while he is holding one or more Lightsabers, he may use his reaction to reduce the damage taken by 1d10+15. If the damage is reduced to 0, he may use this reaction to make a Lightsaber attack against the attacker.

monster.description:
Kaleesh were reptilian humanoids from the planet Kalee. They had scaly skin, tusks, and long nostrils, though few outsiders ever saw a Kaleesh face that wasn't obscured behind a traditional mask. Kaleesh culture was deeply spiritual and warlike. War was seen as an essential part of life, and wars between tribes were common.
BROTHERS OF THE KOLKPRAVIS
The Kolkpravis were a large united band of Kaleesh tribal warriors from the eastern hemisphere of the planet Kalee. The organization of the kolkpravis was naturally tribal, as well as the names. The beginning rank of the kolkpravis was a warrior, who made up a kamen. Kamen was lead by a blackarm. Roughly 100 kamen made up a horde, which was lead by a tarkhan. Around 100 to 200 hordes made up a brigade which was lead by baatars.
From several brigades came a khanate' which was lead by one of the eight khans of the Izvoshra. The Supreme Commander of the kolkpravis was the khagan, a title held first by Qymaen jai Sheelal, the infamous Lord Grievous.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Cyborg Khagan (revised)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the cyborg khagan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Jedi Slayer
trait.text: The cyborg khagan has advantage on saving throws against force powers cast by enemies within 5 feet of it. When the cyborg khagan damages an enemy character, they have disadvantage on Concentration saving throws to maintain their force powers.

trait.name: Wrathful Combatant
trait.text: The cyborg khagan's melee attacks deal +3 damage (included in the attack). Additionally, the cyborg khagan has advantage on all Strength checks and saving throws as long as he is not incapacitated.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: When the cyborg khagan is reduced to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the cyborg khagan can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: More Machine than Man
trait.text: The cyborg khagan has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Cowardice
trait.text: While cyborg khagan has less than half its hit points remaining, it can take the Dash or Disengage actions as a Bonus action on each of its turns. Additionally, it has advantage on all Dexterity (Stealth) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: On each of his turns, cyborg khagan can use one of Crush Them!, Frightful Presence, or Whirling Advance and then make two Slam, Lightsaber, or Heavy Blaster Pistol attacks; or he may make four Slam, Lightsaber, or Heavy Blaster Pistol attacks.

action.name: Lightsaber
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack. +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (1d8+9) energy damage.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack.+11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (1d6+9) kinetic damage.

action.name: Heavy Blaster Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack. +8 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) energy damage.

action.name: Crush Them!
action.text: The cyborg khagan can direct one of its allies to strike. When it does so, it chooses an ally within 30 feet who can see or hear it. That ally can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Choose any number of characters within 80 feet. Creatures of the cyborg khagan's choice within 80 feet of it must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the cyborg khagan for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this ability for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Whirling Advance
action.text: Whirling his blades, cyborg khagan advances with a shield of sparks and light. Choose a creature within 30 feet to make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target creature is pushed 10 feet away and the cyborg khagan moves into the space the target creature previously occupied. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. Additionally, the cyborg khagan has advantage on his next attack against the target creature. On a success, cyborg khagan moves into a square adjacent to the target. Opportunity attacks made against the cyborg khagan that are triggered by this move have disadvantage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: When Cyborg Khagan is attacked and hit by an adjacent character while he is holding one or more Lightsabers, he may use his reaction to reduce the damage taken by 1d10+15. If the damage is reduced to 0, he may use this reaction to make a Lightsaber attack against the attacker.

reaction.name: Jedi Slayer.
reaction.text: When a creature within 5 feet of the cyborg khagan casts a force power, the cyborg khagan use its reaction to make a melee attack against that creature.

legendary.text: The cyborg khagan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The cyborg khagan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Weapon Attack
legendary.text: The cyborg khagan makes one Lightsaber, Slam, or Heavy Blaster Pistol attack.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The cyborg khagan can move up to its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Advanced Cybernetic Actions (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The cyborg khagan can use either its Whirling Advance or Crush Them! actions.

trait.text: History = Lore, Arcana = Technology, Religion = Piloting

trait.name: Force Resistance

trait.name: Forcecasting (Spellcasting)
trait.text: The dark lord is an 18th-level forcecaster. Its forcecasting ability is Wisdom (power save DC 17, +9 to hit with force attacks) and it has 72 force points. The dark lord knows the following force powers:

• At-will:affect mind (Universal Force), denounce (dark force), force push/pull (universal Force), mind trick (universal Force), saber reflect (universal Force), saber ward (universal Force), shock (dark Force)

• 7th-level:force lightning cone (dark Force)
• 8th-level:master force immunity (universal Force)

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) energy damage.

monster.name: Dark Lord Spirit
monster.immune: poison; kinetic, ion and energy from unenhanced weapons

trait.name: Spellcasting - Innate Forcecasting
trait.text: The spirit's forceasting ability is Charisma (force save DC 23). It can innately cast the following force powers:
• At-will: coerce mind (universal Force), fear (dark Force), improved feedback (dark Force), sense force (universal Force), sever force (universal Force)
• 3/day each: darkness (dark Force), dominate mind (dark Force), force project (universal Force), force suppression (universal Force), sanctuary (light Force), telekinesis (universal Force)
• 1/day each: dominate monster (dark Force), improved force camouflage (universal Force), mass animation (universal Force)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance
trait.text: (3/day). If the spirit fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead

trait.name: Tech Resistance
trait.text: The spirit has advantage on saving throws against tech powers

trait.name: Regional Effects
trait.text: • The area within 6 miles of the lair becomes overpopulated with lizards, poisonous snakes, and other venoumous beasts.
• Beasts within 1 mile of the lair become violent and crazed -- even creatures that are normally docile.
• Intelligent creatures within half of a mile of the lair frequently see hallucinations of long-dead friends and comrades that vanish after only a brief glimpse.
If the Dark Lord Spirit dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spirirt attacks twice with Force Saber

action.name: Force Saber
action.text: Melee Power Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (4d6+6) energy damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The spirit teleports up to 120 feet into an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), a Dark Lord Spirit can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

• Dark Lord Spirit casts the coerce mind power on every creature of his choice in the lair. It needn't see each one, but it must be aware that an individual is in the lair to target that creature. It issues the same command to all the targets.

• Dark Lord Spirit casts the darkness power four times at its lowest level, targeting different areas with the power. It doesn't need to concentrate on the powers, which end on initiative count 20 of the next round.

legendary.text: The Dark Lord Spirit can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Dark Lord Spirit regains spent legendary actions at the start of their turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The spirit attacks once with Force Saber.

legendary.name: Dark Lightning
legendary.text: Ranged Power Attack: +13 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 23 Strength saving throw or become shocked until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Sow Discord
legendary.text: The spirit casts coerce mind (universal Force) or fear (dark Force).

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: The spirit uses its teleport action

monster.description:
Some incredibly powerful dark force users can bind themselves to a location and physically manifest and remain incredibly potent over a limited geographic area, such as a cave, copse, or abandoned city. This location is their lair.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Dark Side Spirit
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.conditionImmune: Charmed, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, exhaustion

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Maddening Touch
action.text: Melee Power Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6+3) psychic damage.

action.name: Whispers of Madness
action.text: The spirit chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 7 (1d8 + 3) psychic damage and must use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the spirit's choice that the spirit can see.

action.name: Howling Babble (Recharge 6)
action.text: Each creature within 30 feet of the spirit that can hear it must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 12 (2d8 + 3) psychic damage, and it is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

monster.description:
While most Jedi would lose their solid form and become one with the Force upon their death, some had learned a technique to retain their own identities separate from the Force for a time. Those individuals could linger in the physical world in the form of "Force Spirits," nonphysical entities that exhibited most traits and abilities they had in life. According to the knowledge contained in Asli Krimsan's holocron, that feat could be achieved by sublimating one's organic cells into a state of pure energy.
In its "normal" state, a Force Spirit could only interact with other noncorporeal entities. In order to be heard or seen by the living, the Spirit had to manifest itself. There were different types of manifestation. On a basic level, a Force ghost could appear as a floating, milky gray mass of energy that lacked distinctive features. But it could also manifest itself as the exact image of the dead being during their lifetime, only transparent and emitting a bluish glow. While it could appear to anyone it wished, a spirit could not choose to become audible or visible to only some beings and not the others, since the ability to perceive the manifestation depended on the beholder's strength in the Force. While many Force ghosts could appear as a vision of their former selves unmarked by injury or disease, others still bore the marks of what killed them.
Normally, force spirits could neither harm nor be harmed by physical entities, due to their spiritual nature. For the same reason, they could pass through solid matter effortlessly and were never hampered in their movements. While some spirits would simulate the walk of the living beings, subject to gravity, others would hover and drift above ground level. However, in some cases, a spirit could acquire temporary solidity by drawing on a living creature's link with the Force, which allowed it to actually touch the material world for a time. A manifested spirit could wield Force powers, although not all of them. It also had the ability to travel instantaneously to any point in the galaxy by force of will, as long as the spirit was familiar with that place.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Death Trooper
monster.senses: truesight 15 ft., blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft.

trait.name: Skirmish
trait.text: The trooper can use Disengage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Precise Shot
trait.text: (3/Day). As a bonus action before making a ranged weapon attack, the trooper can take aim at a vital point of a target causing an extra 7 (2d6) energy damage on a hit.

trait.name: Enhanced Sensors
trait.text: The trooper has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Enhanced Weapons
trait.text: The troopers weapon attacks are enhanced.

trait.name: Stealthy
trait.text: The trooper can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If the trooper surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The trooper makes two melee attacks or four ranged attacks.

action.name: Techblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 +4) kinetic damage.

action.name: Blaster Rifle
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) energy damage.

action.name: Volley (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The trooper shoots a rain of deadly blaster bolts in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d8 + 4) energy damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description:
Death troopers were an elite variant of stormtroopers designed for stealth, espionage and lethality. Operating under Imperial Intelligence, they served as protective details and bodyguards for significant Imperial officers as well as special-assignment commandos. Death troopers were trained in unarmed combat, heavy weapons, demolitions, and marksmanship. They were experts at covering their tracks, leaving little to no evidence of their missions.
Stormtrooper candidates who excelled at their training were reassigned to the advanced death trooper camp on Scarif. They were required to exceed traditional stormtrooper standards, including height and weight, and had to meet certain ideological standards. The candidates were also subjected to a battery of physical tests and classified surgical enhancements as well as more rigorous training than standard stormtroopers.
They wore black suits of armor that was much more advanced than standard stormtrooper armor. Their helmet had vocal scramblers, micro-motion sensors, targeting systems, and heads-up displays with data on enemy and friendly positions on the battlefield to give them total situational awareness. Their armor was also covered by a spray polymer called reflec, which warped electromagnetic signals commonly found in sensor arrays, making them well suited for stealth operations. Death troopers were equipped with a variety of weapons depending on their specialities including the SE-14r light repeating blasters, E-11Ds, DLT-19D heavy blaster rifles, C-25 fragmentation grenades and Sonic Imploders.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

monster.name: Destroyer Droid

trait.name: Circuitry.
trait.text: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Ball Form
trait.text: As a bonus action, the destroyer droid can transform into or out of ball form. While in ball form, the destroyer droid has increased speed, but it can not attack.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The destroyer droid makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Blaster Cannons
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 100/400, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) energy damage.

action.name: Blaster Volley
action.text: The destroyer droid sprays a 10-foot-cube area within normal range of its blaster cannons with shots. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking normal weapon damage on a failed save.

reaction.name: Deflector Shield
reaction.text: The destroyer droid adds 3 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the super battle droid must see the attacker.

monster.description:
Destroyer droids, also known as Droidekas or rollies, are a type of heavy battle droid originally crafted by Colicoids. It has a reputation for deadliness due to its resilience and firepower, as well as the fear it can instill in even the most powerful Jedi. They are also used for executions. Destroyer droids are equipped with dual built-in blaster cannons and a built-in deflector shield generator. Due to their ponderous nature, destroyer droids have a ball-form that they can transform into, granting them great speed.
Source: SW5e Scum and Villainy v2019-11-05

trait.name: Circuitry.
trait.text: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Ball Form
trait.text: As a bonus action, the destroyer droid can transform into or out of ball form. While in ball form, the destroyer droid has increased speed, but it can not attack.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The destroyer droid makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) kinetic damage and the target is grappled.

action.name: Rend
action.text: The destroyer droid tears apart a grappled opponent. A grappled creature must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 (4d6+4) kinetic damage and is stunned until the end of the destroyer droids' next turn. On a success, the creature takes normal weapon damage.

reaction.name: Deflector Shield
reaction.text: The destroyer droid adds 2 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the super battle droid must see the attacker.

action.name: Blaster Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit 4 (1d6+1) energy damage. Reload 12.
